content:
This was a mess, well reflected on the rating, but I thought I might try to salvage what I could.

Practically rewrote the whole goal statement and added some minor touches to the rest of it.

Edit: Also rewrote the solution and added a couple tests.

Thanks to everyone who approved it !
I edited a bit the statement and fiddled a bit with the golfed version in python. 
At the moment (18/05/2022) I'm at 115 chars. If someone finds lower, please let us know!

edit:
24/05 -> 110

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Looks like a short and interesting challenge

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: this is an interessant forme of cyclic group. How to complete it when some of them missing.
I think mine is more short.
according the tests:
You needn't test if the sets is the same. You just need know is K is empty.
I=input
n=int(I())
g=I()
L=I().split()
K=[g*i for i in range(1,n)if g*i not in L]
if len(K):print(*K)
else:print(f'Group of size {n}')

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is good example for beginners
I think you need more explanation in statement.
Added a bit of text, renamed the tests and changed it from reverse only to the three modes.
It seems like the previous comments were taken care of. It took me a while (~5 minutes) to do it but it should be fine.

I think your tests and validators are not rigorous enough.

I may ignore the second input and directly test whether the number of elements in the third input is equal to the number in the first input and I am done. I can even ignore what the elements are in the third input.

Code-wise:
n = int(input())
ignore = input()
lst = input().split()
print("True" if n == len(lst) else "False")

Thank you. I guess I'll try this:

test 1 -> example solution
test 2 -> size considerations
test 3 (CHANGED) -> element considerations
test 4 -> order considerations

Nice solution, you are completely right. If you want a bit shorter you could join the last 3 lines of your code:
print(" ".join([g*i for i in range(1,n)if g*i not in L])or f'Group of size {n}')
(note that your "if len(K)" is just "if K")

Please also avoid binary output (there are currently only 2 possible outputs: True/False). See point 4 of the Specific Guidelines here:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/contribution-guidelines
Ah, my bad. I changed it a bit, I wonder if now it's a bit too hard for a reverse mm...
Thank you. I think the difficulty level should still be ok after the changes.
